docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton was challenged over the issue of abortion yesterday for the first time in her re-election race this year, as a possible Republican opponent tried to chip away at her image as a moderate who supports adoption. John Spencer, who leads the field of Republican candidates in endorsements and fund-raising, visited a pregnancy center in Brooklyn that promotes adoption and denounced new federal legislation that would regulate advertising for these centers. The centers often operate near and compete with abortion providers, sometimes by using graphic material to discourage abortion.

headline.main: In Senate Race, Republican Candidate Questions Mrs. Clinton's Abortion Message

docs.abstract: New York Republican senatorial hopeful John Spencer denounces new federal legislation that would regulate advertising for centers that promote adoption; scores incumbent Sen Hillary Clinton for supporting legislation; centers often operate near and compete with abortion providers (M)
docs.snippet: A possible Republican opponent tried to chip away at Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton's image as a moderate who supports adoption.
